Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.

What tyme Ã¾at processyon is enteryd in to Ã¾e place and Ã¾e herowdys takyn his schaffalde and pylat and annas and cayphas here schaffaldys Also Ã¾an come Ã¾er An exposytour in doctorys wede Ã¾us seyng Contemplacio Sofreynes and frendys ?e mut alle be gret with gode Grace love and charyte evyr be ?ou A-mong Ã¾e maydenys sone preserve ?ou Ã¾at for man deyd on rode he Ã¾at is o god in personys thre defende ?ou fro ?our fon. Be Ã¾e leue and soferauns of all-mythty god We intendyn to procede Ã¾e matere Ã¾at we lefte Ã¾e last ?ere Where fore we be-seche ?ow Ã¾at ?our wyllys be good to kepe Ã¾e passyon in ?our mende Ã¾at xal be shewyd here. The last ?ere we shewyd here how oure lord for love of man Cam to Ã¾e cety of jherusalem mekely his deth to take And how he made his mawnde his body ?evyng Ã¾an to his Apostelys evyr with us to A-bydyn for mannys sake. In Ã¾at mawnde he was betrayd of judas Ã¾at hym solde to Ã¾e jewys for xxxt i platys to delyvyr hym Ã¾at nyth With swerdys and gleyvys toke jhesu they come with Ã¾e tretour bolde And toke hym amonges his Apostelys About myd nyth. Now wold we procede how he was browth Ã¾an be-forn Annas and cayphas and syth beforn pylate And so forth in his passyon how mekely he toke it for man besekyng ?ou for mede of ?our soulys to take good hede Ã¾er Atte. here Ã¾e herowndys xal shewe hymself and speke. herodes Rex Now sees of ?our talkyng And gevyth lordly Audyence Not o word I charge ?ou Ã¾at ben here present noon so hardy to presume in my hey presence to on-lose hese lyppys Ageyn myn intent I am herowde of jewys kyng most reverent Ã¾e lawys of Mahownde my powere xal fortefye reverens to Ã¾at lord of grace moost excyllent Ffor be his powere all Ã¾inge doth multyplye. ?ef ony crystyn be so hardy his feyth to denye Or onys to erre Ageyns his lawe On gebettys with cheynes I xal hangyn hym heye and with wylde hors Ã¾o traytorys xal I drawe To kylle A thowsand crystyn I gyf not An hawe to se hem hangyn or brent to me is very plesauns to dryvyn hem in to doongenyns dragonys to knawe And to rend here flesche and bonys on-to here sustenauns. Johan Ã¾e baptyst crystenyd cryst and so he dede many on Ã¾er-fore my-self dede hym bryng o dawe It is I Ã¾at dede hym kylle I telle ?ou every-chon Ffor And he had go forth he xuld A dystroyd our lawe Where as crystyn Apperyth to me is gret grevauns It peynyth myn hert of tho tretowrys to here Ffor Ã¾e lawys of mahownde I have in governawns Ã¾e which I wele kepe Ã¾at lord hath no pere Ffor he is god most prudent Now I charge ?ou my lordys Ã¾at ben here Yf Any crystyn doggys here doth Apere Bryng Ã¾o tretorys to my hey powere And Ã¾ei xal haue sone jewgement. ius miles My sovereyn lord heyest of excillens In ?ou all jewgement is termynabyle all crystyn doggys Ã¾at do not here dyligens ?e put hem to peynes Ã¾at ben inportable. ijus miles No Ã¾ing in ?ou may be more comendable as to dysstroye Ã¾o traytorys Ã¾at erre ageyn oure lawys Ã¾at ben most profytable be rythwysnesse Ã¾at lawe ?e must proferre. Rex Herow Now be gloryous mahownd my sovereyn savyour these promessys I make as I am trewe knyth Ã¾oo Ã¾at excede his lawys be ony errour to Ã¾e most xamefullest deth I xal hem dyth But o thyng is sore in my gret delyte Ã¾ere is on jhesus of nazareth as men me tellyth of Ã¾at man I desyre to han A sythte ffor with many gret wondrys oure lawe he fellyth. The son of god hym-self he callyth And kyng of jewys he seyth is he And many woundrys of hym be-fallyth My hert desyryth hym for to se Serys yf Ã¾at he come in Ã¾is cowntre With oure jurresdyccion loke ?e A-spye And a-non Ã¾at he be brouth on-to me And Ã¾e trewth myself Ã¾an xal trye. ius miles To-morwe my jorne I xal begynne to seke jhesus with my dew dilygens ?yf he come ?our provynce with-inne he xal not a-skape ?our hey presens. ijus miles Myn sovereyn Ã¾is my councel Ã¾at ?e xal take A man Ã¾at is bothe wyse and stronge thurwe all galyle A serge to make yf jhesu be enteryd ?our pepyl A-mong Correcte hese dedys Ã¾at be do wronge Ffor his body is vndyr ?our bayle as men talkyn hem among Ã¾at he was born in galyle. Rex Thanne of Ã¾ese materys serys take hede Ffor A whyle I wele me rest Appetyde requyryth me so in dede And ffesyk tellyth me it is Ã¾e best.
